intro: Paraboea verticillata, commonly known as the mountain pepper or false pepper, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in whorls around the stem. Its fruit is a small, round berry that contains several seeds. Paraboea verticillata is often found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to cool, temperate climates.
